publicFunctions.argsString: (const thrust::detail::execution_policy_base< DerivedPolicy > &exec, InputIterator first, InputIterator last, OutputIterator result)
publicFunctions.details: copy copies elements from the range [first, last) to the range [result, result + (last - first)). That is, it performs the assignments *result = *first, *(result + 1) = *(first + 1), and so on. Generally, for every integer n from 0 to last - first, copy performs the assignment *(result + n) = *(first + n). Unlike std::copy, copy offers no guarantee on order of operation. As a result, calling copy with overlapping source and destination ranges has undefined behavior. The return value is result + (last - first). The algorithm's execution is parallelized as determined by exec. The following code snippet demonstrates how to use copy to copy from one range to another using the thrust::device parallelization policy: ```cpp #include #include #include ... thrust::device_vector vec0(100); thrust::device_vector vec1(100); ... thrust::copy(thrust::device, vec0.begin(), vec0.end(), vec1.begin()); // vec1 is now a copy of vec0 ```
publicFunctions.name: copy

paramList.name: exec
paramList.text: The execution policy to use for parallelization.

paramList.name: first
paramList.text: The beginning of the sequence to copy.

paramList.name: last
paramList.text: The end of the sequence to copy.

paramList.name: result
paramList.text: The destination sequence.

pre: result may be equal to first, but result shall not be in the range [first, last) otherwise.
returns: The end of the destination sequence.

templateParamsList.name: DerivedPolicy
templateParamsList.text: The name of the derived execution policy.

templateParamsList.name: InputIterator
templateParamsList.text: must be a model of Input Iterator and InputIterator'svalue_type must be convertible to OutputIterator'svalue_type.

templateParamsList.name: OutputIterator
templateParamsList.text: must be a model of Output Iterator.

publicFunctions.title: copy

publicFunctions.argsString: (const thrust::detail::execution_policy_base< DerivedPolicy > &exec, InputIterator first, Size n, OutputIterator result)
publicFunctions.details: copy_n copies elements from the range [first, first + n) to the range [result, result + n). That is, it performs the assignments *result = *first, *(result + 1) = *(first + 1), and so on. Generally, for every integer i from 0 to n, copy performs the assignment *(result + i) = *(first + i). Unlike std::copy_n, copy_n offers no guarantee on order of operation. As a result, calling copy_n with overlapping source and destination ranges has undefined behavior. The return value is result + n. The algorithm's execution is parallelized as determined by exec. The following code snippet demonstrates how to use copy to copy from one range to another using the thrust::device parallelization policy: ```cpp #include #include #include ... size_t n = 100; thrust::device_vector vec0(n); thrust::device_vector vec1(n); ... thrust::copy_n(thrust::device, vec0.begin(), n, vec1.begin()); // vec1 is now a copy of vec0 ```
publicFunctions.name: copy_n

paramList.name: exec
paramList.text: The execution policy to use for parallelization.

paramList.name: first
paramList.text: The beginning of the range to copy.

paramList.name: n
paramList.text: The number of elements to copy.

paramList.name: result
paramList.text: The beginning destination range.

pre: result may be equal to first, but result shall not be in the range [first, first + n) otherwise.
returns: The end of the destination range.

templateParamsList.name: DerivedPolicy
templateParamsList.text: The name of the derived execution policy.

templateParamsList.name: InputIterator
templateParamsList.text: must be a model of Input Iterator and InputIterator'svalue_type must be convertible to OutputIterator'svalue_type.

templateParamsList.name: Size
templateParamsList.text: is an integral type.

templateParamsList.text: must be a model of Output Iterator.

publicFunctions.argsString: (const thrust::detail::execution_policy_base< DerivedPolicy > &exec, ForwardIterator1 first1, ForwardIterator1 last1, ForwardIterator2 first2)
publicFunctions.details: swap_ranges swaps each of the elements in the range [first1, last1) with the corresponding element in the range [first2, first2 + (last1 - first1)). That is, for each integer n such that 0 <= n < (last1 - first1), it swaps *(first1 + n) and *(first2 + n). The return value is first2 + (last1 - first1). The algorithm's execution is parallelized as determined by exec. The following code snippet demonstrates how to use swap_ranges to swap the contents of two thrust::device_vectors using the thrust::device execution policy for parallelization: ```cpp #include #include #include ... thrust::device_vector v1(2), v2(2); v1[0] = 1; v1[1] = 2; v2[0] = 3; v2[1] = 4; thrust::swap_ranges(thrust::device, v1.begin(), v1.end(), v2.begin()); // v1[0] == 3, v1[1] == 4, v2[0] == 1, v2[1] == 2 ```
publicFunctions.name: swap_ranges

paramList.name: exec
paramList.text: The execution policy to use for parallelization.

paramList.name: first1
paramList.text: The beginning of the first sequence to swap.

paramList.name: last1
paramList.text: One position past the last element of the first sequence to swap.

paramList.name: first2
paramList.text: The beginning of the second sequence to swap.

pre: first1 may equal first2, but the range [first1, last1) shall not overlap the range [first2, first2 + (last1 - first1)) otherwise.
returns: An iterator pointing to one position past the last element of the second sequence to swap.

templateParamsList.name: DerivedPolicy
templateParamsList.text: The name of the derived execution policy.

templateParamsList.name: ForwardIterator1
templateParamsList.text: is a model of Forward Iterator, and ForwardIterator1'svalue_type must be convertible to ForwardIterator2'svalue_type.

templateParamsList.name: ForwardIterator2
templateParamsList.text: is a model of Forward Iterator, and ForwardIterator2'svalue_type must be convertible to ForwardIterator1'svalue_type.

publicFunctions.title: swap_ranges

publicFunctions.details: swap_ranges swaps each of the elements in the range [first1, last1) with the corresponding element in the range [first2, first2 + (last1 - first1)). That is, for each integer n such that 0 <= n < (last1 - first1), it swaps *(first1 + n) and *(first2 + n). The return value is first2 + (last1 - first1). The following code snippet demonstrates how to use swap_ranges to swap the contents of two thrust::device_vectors. ```cpp #include #include ... thrust::device_vector v1(2), v2(2); v1[0] = 1; v1[1] = 2; v2[0] = 3; v2[1] = 4; thrust::swap_ranges(v1.begin(), v1.end(), v2.begin()); // v1[0] == 3, v1[1] == 4, v2[0] == 1, v2[1] == 2 ```
publicFunctions.name: swap_ranges

paramList.name: first1
paramList.text: The beginning of the first sequence to swap.

paramList.name: last1
paramList.text: One position past the last element of the first sequence to swap.

paramList.name: first2
paramList.text: The beginning of the second sequence to swap.

pre: first1 may equal first2, but the range [first1, last1) shall not overlap the range [first2, first2 + (last1 - first1)) otherwise.
returns: An iterator pointing to one position past the last element of the second sequence to swap.

templateParamsList.name: ForwardIterator1
templateParamsList.text: is a model of Forward Iterator, and ForwardIterator1'svalue_type must be convertible to ForwardIterator2'svalue_type.

templateParamsList.name: ForwardIterator2
templateParamsList.text: is a model of Forward Iterator, and ForwardIterator2'svalue_type must be convertible to ForwardIterator1'svalue_type.

publicFunctions.name: uninitialized_copy

paramList.name: exec
paramList.text: The execution policy to use for parallelization.

paramList.name: first
paramList.text: The first element of the input range to copy from.

paramList.name: last
paramList.text: The last element of the input range to copy from.

paramList.name: result
paramList.text: The first element of the output range to copy to.

pre: first may equal result, but the range [first, last) and the range [result, result + (last - first)) shall not overlap otherwise.
returns: An iterator pointing to the last element of the output range.

templateParamsList.name: DerivedPolicy
templateParamsList.text: The name of the derived execution policy.

templateParamsList.name: InputIterator
templateParamsList.text: is a model of Input Iterator.

templateParamsList.name: ForwardIterator
templateParamsList.text: is a model of Forward Iterator, ForwardIterator is mutable, and ForwardIterator'svalue_type has a constructor that takes a single argument whose type is InputIterator'svalue_type.
